meta.title: PPSC FPSC BPSC KPPS
meta.description: Multiple choice questions from the Excise and Taxation Inspector PPSC Past Paper held in the Evening, 2024.
meta.keywords: PPSC, Excise and Taxation Inspector, Past Paper, MCQs, 2024

subcategories.title: Excise and Taxation Inspector PPSC Past Papers 2024 Evening

questions.q: The book “A leadership Odyssey” is written by
questions.ex: The book 'A Leadership Odyssey' is written by Sikandar Hayat.

questions.q: Which city is called the Gateway of Pakistan:
questions.ex: Karachi is often referred to as the Gateway of Pakistan.

questions.q: The continent of Europe is separated from Asia by:
questions.ex: The Ural Mountains and parts of the Caspian Sea form a natural boundary between Europe and Asia.

questions.q: How many rings are on the Olympics?
questions.ex: There are five rings on the Olympic flag.

questions.q: Who was the U.S. president during the U-2 crisis?
questions.ex: Dwight D. Eisenhower was the U.S. president during the U-2 crisis in 1960.

questions.q: Sharm al-Sheikh is located in:
questions.ex: Sharm al-Sheikh is a city on the southern tip of the Sinai Peninsula, in Egypt.

questions.q: A hybrid computer is:
questions.ex: A hybrid computer combines features of both analog and digital computers.

questions.q: Brain of computer is:
questions.ex: The CPU (Central Processing Unit) is considered the brain of the computer.

questions.q: The members of the International court of justice shall be elected for:
questions.ex: Judges of the International Court of Justice are elected for a term of nine years.

questions.q: In the sentence “He is a good athlete”, the word “athlete” is:
questions.ex: The word 'athlete' is a noun, referring to a person who is proficient in sports and other forms of physical exercise.

questions.q: What do the 5 Olympic rings represent?
questions.ex: The five rings represent the five inhabited continents of the world: Africa, the Americas, Asia, Europe, and Oceania.

questions.q: Nandana Fort is located in:
questions.ex: Nandana Fort is located in the Punjab province of Pakistan.

questions.q: Who was the first Secretary General of the United Nations?
questions.ex: Trygve Halvdan Lie was the first Secretary-General of the United Nations.

questions.q: Mehrgarh Civilization found in:
questions.ex: The Mehrgarh civilization is an archaeological site located in Balochistan, Pakistan.

questions.q: Jhangir Khan is famous in which sports?
questions.ex: Jahangir Khan is a legendary figure in the sport of Squash.

questions.q: East Germany, North Korea and Cambodia were recognized during the reign of which prime minister:
questions.ex: These countries were recognized during the premiership of Zulfikar Ali Bhutto.

questions.q: I can not come to see you _ tomorrow:
questions.ex: 'Until' or 'till' are typically used in this context to indicate a time limit. 'Until' is generally more formal than 'till'.

questions.q: The intensity of an earthquake is measured on:
questions.ex: The intensity of an earthquake is commonly measured on the Richter scale or the Moment Magnitude Scale.

questions.q: How many lakes are in the African Great Lakes?
questions.ex: There are typically considered to be seven or eight major lakes in the African Great Lakes region, depending on the definition used.

questions.q: What is the extension for a graphical file?
questions.ex: JPG, GIF, and PNG are all common file extensions for graphical files.

questions.q: Cape Town is a city in which country?
questions.ex: Cape Town is a port city on South Africa’s southwest coast.

questions.q: The foundation stone of Jinnah’s Mausoleum was laid by Field Marshal Mohammed Ayub Khan on:
questions.ex: The foundation stone of Mazar-e-Quaid was laid by President Ayub Khan on March 31, 1960.

questions.q: Which hemisphere is warming faster than the other?
questions.ex: The Northern Hemisphere is generally warming faster than the Southern Hemisphere due to the distribution of landmasses and feedback loops.

questions.q: What is used to access information on the Internet?
questions.ex: A web browser is the primary software application used to access information on the Internet.

questions.q: How many nephrons are there _____ per kidney in humans?
questions.ex: Each human kidney contains approximately 1 million nephrons.
